component.name: Corese-Gui
component.summary: Unlock the power of the Semantic Web

description.p: Corese is an all-inclusive software platform engineered to faithfully implement and creatively extend the Semantic Web standards set forth by the W3C. This spans a wide range of technologies, including RDF, RDFS, SPARQL 1.1 Query & Update, OWL RL, SHACL, and beyond.

Corese-Gui is the graphical user interface to the Corese platform, serving as an intuitive gateway for the Semantic Web. It offers a rich set of features that facilitate the creation, manipulation, analysis, serialization, and querying of RDF data.

Moreover, the GUI brings advanced capabilities to your fingertips, incorporating extended functionalities such as STTL SPARQL, SPARQL Rule, and LDScript. This enhances your data processing and reasoning workflows, making Corese-GUI an indispensable tool for both novices and experts in the Semantic Web domain.

- Fixed warning: "sun.reflect.Reflection.getCallerClass is not supported".
- Updated json library from 20180813 to 20230227.

- Added support of storage Systems (Jena TDB1, RDF4J Model)
- Added Beta support for RDF* and SPARQL* (Community Group Report 17 December 2021)
- Added Undo/Redo support
- Fixed an encoding error when loading a file whose path contains a space
- Fixed SPARQL engine bug where it was impossible to load a named graph that contains a non-empty RDF list.
- Fixed issue with "rdf:" not found when sending a federated query to Fuseki.
- Fixed non-standard JSON format on query timeout.
- Fixed inconsistent status of the OWL and Rules checkboxes that was not updated during reload.
- Fixed the rule engine that was implementing optimizations incompatible with the `owl:propertyChainAxiom` rule.

- Added graphical editor for SHACL file.
- Added graphical editor for TURTLE file.
- Added save graph option.
